content.description: Fun link up of a few moves between a few different problems. Sit start matched on Low Ballin' jug and trend right using the Aqua Man dimple/sloper and top out same as Honey.

Classic right to left lowball sloper traverse. Move on slopers, heel, and toe-hooks toward the arete. Most people topout at an obvious spot about four feet before you get to the arete. If you are 5'8" or taller, you will probably be able to make a long reach up to a horizontal at the end of this traverse, and it might feel easy for the grade. If you are short, you'll have to do a legit hard mantle.

The original line of this problem continues all the way to the arete, eliminating the mantle but adding some harder sloper moves. This way probably makes it legit v6; most folks feel the standard way is a bit soft.
content.protection: Pads; landing gets a bit worse at the end when you're pumped.
content.location: On the side of the boulder facing the highway.

content.description: Start in back of pit on cobbly rock. Climb straight back and right out roof to prow by tree. Finish up prow.
content.location: This route is on the Malone Boulder, pretty far right of Slopers Malone. When facing start holds, your back will be to the problem "V9s" (V4). It starts down in a pit.

content.description: Sit start on boulder matched on big jug, climb straight up on jugs.
This boulder is the ending mantle of Slopers Malone. Sit start on the furthest left slopers before the face becomes blank and go up.
content.protection: One or maybe two crash pads
content.location: Located right of the arete that runs up the left side of the Malone Boulder.

content.description: Fun warm-up! Sit start on jug and climb good edges trending right to a flake and fun top out.
content.location: Far right side of Slopers Malone boulder, 15 feet from main trail

content.description: A finger intensive traverse with poor feet!  Sit start with your left hand on a low jug and your right hand on a small crimp pocket up and right of the jug.  Traverse left to a jug on the arete before topping out.
content.protection: Several crash pads, there is a depression under the boulder
content.location: Look for the low, vertical face on the back side of the Malone Boulder.  This boulder starts low and follows a small, diagonal crack.

content.description: Same start as Mines of Moria in the pit of Malone Boulder. Pull the first lengthy move to a deep slot, move left to a bump off a jutting edge into a large pocket. Rock over left, stand up to find a large sidepull jug, and make a couple easy moves to climb out of the pit.
Low start left hand pocket with right hand sidepull crimp. Big move up to dimple/sloper hold and same top out as Honey.
